# ÄŸ silent g  

 yumuÅŸak g ("soft g"), written âŸ¨ÄŸâŸ© in Turkish orthography, represents a vowel sequence or a rather weak bilabial approximant between rounded vowels, a weak palatal approximant between unrounded front vowels, and a vowel sequence elsewhere. It never occurs at the beginning of a word or a syllable, but always follows a vowel. When word-final or preceding another consonant, it lengthens the preceding vowel.[58]  

The silence of ÄŸ was captured perfectly by philosophical logicians:
